node.title: House Majority Leader Steny Hoyer says he tested positive for COVID-19
node.description: The 82-year-old representative said he is vaccinated and boosted.

node.title: Oath Keepers founder set to be deposed by the House January 6 Committee on Wednesday
node.description: Attorneys for Stewart Rhodes say they expect their client to invoke 5th Amendment right when interviewed by investigators.

node.title: Former Dolphins coach sues NFL and 3 teams, alleging racist hiring practices
node.description: "In certain critical ways, the NFL is racially segregated and is managed much like a plantation," the lawsuit said.

node.title: Questions Remain After Highway Crash Involving Monkeys
node.description: A Pennsylvania woman who had contact with them says she has signs of illness, but no one else has reported symptoms. And the airline that shipped them here is getting out of the business.

node.title: Brady set the GOAT bar.
node.description: With seven Super Bowl titles, his first two decades ago at age 24, Brady redefined success for N.F.L. quarterbacks.

node.title: 2 campus police officers shot at Bridgewater College in Virginia
node.description: A suspect has been taken into custody.

node.title: Dairy prices on the rise amid supply contraints
node.description: Global dairy prices have hit their highest level in eight years raising the prospect of further rises in dairy farmer payouts.

node.title: Shortage of right-hand drive EVs slowing carbon emissions progress - MIA
node.description: The Motor Industry Association will ask the government to ease back on its targets for new vehicle carbon emissions.

node.title: 'Danger time': E coli detected in Taranaki waterways after rainfall
node.description: A new fresh water testing methodology confirms that the region's waterways are contaminated with bacteria after rain, ecologists say.

node.title: Ukraine announces plan to boost army, US demands Russian de-escalation
node.description: Ukraine's president has signed a decree to boost his armed forces by 100,000 troops over three years, as European leaders lined up to back him in a standoff with Russia.

node.title: Tonga to enter lockdown after port workers test positive for Covid-19
node.description: The Kingdom of Tonga will go into nationwide lockdown from 6pm on Wednesday.

node.title: Pfizer asks FDA to allow COVID-19 vaccine for kids under 5
node.description: Children under the age of 5 are the only group not yet eligible for vaccination — but that could change soon.

node.title: WA to allow triple road trains in attempt to fill supermarket shelves
node.description: Western Australia will allow trucks to haul three semi-trailers in order to bring more freight into the state and fill supermarket shelves left empty after extreme flooding in South Australia.

node.title: 'An obvious risk': Norwegian court denies far-right extremist's parole request
node.description: A Norwegian court denies the parole request of convicted mass murderer Anders Behring Breivik, who killed 77 people in a bombing and shooting spree in Norway in 2011.

node.title: 'If we can't get the materials we can't work': Shortages delay build times
node.description: Tradespeople and building suppliers are struggling to get their hands on basic materials such as exterior and interior cladding, causing delays that are doubling some build times.

node.title: 'Massive increase': Rapid rise in home-schooling plans surprises principals
node.description: Principals say some parents are threatening to take their children out of school because of the mask mandate for older primary school children.

node.title: Two men arrested for death threats against Biden
node.description: One man said he was going to "cut the head off the snake in the heart of the nation" and that God had told him to drive to Washington to see the president.

node.title: The Best Movies and TV Shows Coming to HBO, Hulu, Apple TV+ and More in February
node.description: Every month, streaming services add movies and TV shows to its library. Here are our picks for some of February’s most promising new titles.

node.title: Thousands Told to Evacuate as North Carolina Fertilizer Plant Burns
node.description: The fire broke out on Monday night at the plant in Winston-Salem, where more than 6,000 people within a mile of the plant were told to leave over worries of a possible explosion.

node.title: Border delays and a crash in house prices are the main risks facing the economy - OECD
node.description: The Organisation of Economic Cooperation and Development's survey of the country says the economy is starting to overheat having been supported by government support measures to counter the pandemic. Audio

node.title: Lack of evidence unravels Lois Tolley murder case
node.description: The case against three men charged with the murder of Upper Hutt woman Lois Tolley in 2016 has unravelled due to lack of evidence.

node.title: Westport and Buller prepare for heavy rain, locals warned to avoid non-essential travel
node.description: A heavy rain red warning has been issued for Buller and Westland districts - the most serious weather warning there is. Audio

node.title: MPI consider timing of new cattle barn restrictions
node.description: The Ministry for Primary Industries is consulting on when to bring in new rules that'll impact farmers using barn systems to house dairy cattle.

node.title: Senator Ben Ray Luján undergoes surgery after a stroke
node.description: The 49-year-old senator underwent surgery to ease swelling after he was found to have suffered a stroke in his cerebellum that affected his balance.

node.title: Colleagues isolating as airport worker's positive result announced
node.description: A staff member at Hawke's Bay Airport has tested positive for Covid-19.

node.title: One student dead and one injured after shooting outside of Minnesota school
node.description: Local and state officials are actively investigating​ the incident.

node.title: Post-Covid tourism living on a strategy of hope
node.description: The Detail - There's a new word in tourism of the future - regenerative - and it could be the thing that saves the industry.

node.title: Pence's former chief counsel speaks to House January 6 committee
node.description: Greg Jacob, who reportedly was with the former vice president on January 6, is the latest member of Pence's team to speak with the committee.

node.title: J&J, drug distributors to pay tribes $590M in opioids deal
node.description: Landmark legal settlement offers "measure of justice" to Native American communities hit by opioid epidemic.

node.title: Organisers pull the pin on NZ Golf Open
node.description: The New Zealand Golf Open has again been scrapped due to Covid-19 restrictions.
